goal.ch:
本課程的教學目標在使學生：
一、掌握數位學習發展最新趨勢
二、培養數位學習領域專業素養與跨領域整合能力
三、瞭解數位學習相關產業發展現況
四、加強未來數位創新能力與數位實踐能力
五、了解人工智慧應用於教育上的實踐與素養
goal.en: This course is an invaluable platform for graduate students to gain deep insights into the latest research and practices in the field of e-learning. Every week, we will host a distinguished researcher or expert in e-learning to deliver a compelling talk. Following the lecture, students will actively engage in discussions with the guest speaker.

outline.en:
The primary objective of this course is to equip students with a comprehensive understanding of the evolving landscape of digital learning. This will be achieved through several key goals. Firstly, students will gain a solid grasp of current trends in digital learning, enabling them to stay ahead in this rapidly changing field. Secondly, the course aims to develop students‘ professional competence in the domain of digital learning, alongside fostering the ability to integrate knowledge across multiple disciplines. This interdisciplinary approach is essential for addressing the complex challenges encountered in modern educational environments.
Additionally, the course will provide students with an in-depth understanding of the current state of the digital learning industry. This knowledge is critical for students who wish to pursue careers in this sector, as it will allow them to navigate and contribute effectively to industry developments. Another crucial aspect of the course is to enhance students‘ abilities in digital innovation and practical application. By focusing on these skills, the course prepares students to be proactive in creating and implementing digital solutions that address educational needs in innovative ways.
Finally, the course will delve into the theories and practices surrounding the application of artificial intelligence (AI) in education. Students will explore how AI can be used to enhance learning outcomes, personalize education, and improve administrative processes within educational institutions. Through this comprehensive approach, the course aims to prepare students to be leaders in the field of digital learning, equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to drive future innovations and effectively implement AI in educational settings.

gradMethod.ch:
一、課堂出席與提問 (20％)
課堂出席及參與提問，若無法出席，請與老師及助教請假。
二、個人心得報告 (40％)
每次演講後，撰寫個人心得報告，共八次。心得內容不需詳述演講內容，請多著墨個人心得與跟自己研究的關係。報告需於每週四演講結束後至下週一中午前上傳至系統。
三、小組期末報告 (40％)
小組成員需於期末進行口頭報告，每組報告(含討論)時間約20分鐘。
gradMethod.en:
1. **Class Attendance and Participation (20％)**  
Attendance and participation in class discussions are required. If you are unable to attend a class, please notify the instructor and teaching assistant in advance.

2. **Individual Reflection Reports (40％)**  
After each lecture, students must write an individual reflection report, with a total of eight reports required. The reflection should focus on your personal insights and how the lecture content relates to your own research, rather than simply summarizing the lecture. Reports must be submitted to the system by noon on the Monday following each Thursday lecture.

3. **Group Final Presentation (40％)**  
Group members are required to give an oral presentation at the end of the semester. Each group will have approximately 20 minutes for their presentation, including the discussion.

flexDiscription.ch: 以線上相關教學資源以及課後省思與實作，鼓勵學生自主學習與. 探索跨域知識。
flexDiscription.en: By utilizing online educational resources, along with post-class reflections and hands-on activities, students are encouraged to engage in self-directed learning and explore interdisciplinary knowledge.
